name: Shiro Nishiyama
text: Action: During a conflict, bow this stronghold – each defending character you control gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] until the end of the conflict.

name: Shizuka Toshi
text: Action: During a [conflict-political] conflict, bow this stronghold. Choose a participating character with [conflict-political] skill 2 or lower – bow that character.

name: Mountain's Anvil Castle
text: Action: During a conflict, bow this stronghold. Choose a participating character with 1 or more attachments on it – until the end of the conflict, that character gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] (+2[conflict-military] and +2[conflict-political] instead if it has 2 or more attachments on it).

name: Yōjin no Shiro
text: Action: During a conflict, bow this stronghold – each attacking character you control gets +1[conflict-military] until the end of the conflict.

name: Isawa Mori Seidō
text: Action: Bow this stronghold, choose a character – that character gets +2 glory until the end of the phase.

name: City of the Open Hand
text: Action: If you are less honorable than an opponent, bow this stronghold and select one – either that opponent loses 1 honor, or you gain 1 honor. Errata from RRG v9

name: Golden Plains Outpost
text: Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict, bow this stronghold. Choose a Cavalry character you control – move it to that conflict.

name: Defend the Wall
text: Reaction: After you win a conflict at this province – resolve the ring effect of that conflict as if you were the attacking player.

name: The Art of Peace
text: Interrupt: When this province is broken – dishonor each attacking character and honor each defending character.

name: Restoration of Balance
text: Interrupt: When this province is broken – your opponent chooses and discards cards from his or her hand until that player has 4 or fewer cards in hand. Errata from RRG v9

name: The Art of War
text: Interrupt: When this province is broken – draw 3 cards.

name: Kuroi Mori
text: Action: During a conflict at this province, select one – switch the contested ring with an unclaimed ring (the conflict retains its cardType), or switch the conflict cardType (the conflict retains its element).

name: Secret Cache
text: Reaction: After a conflict is declared against this province – search the top 5 cards of your conflict deck for a card and add it to your hand. Shuffle.

name: Endless Plains
text: Reaction: After an attack is declared here, break this province. Your opponent chooses an attacking character – discard that character.

name: Ancestral Lands
text: This province gets +5 strength during [conflict-political] conflicts.

name: Elemental Fury
text: Reaction: After this province is revealed – switch the contested ring with an unclaimed ring. (The conflict retains its cardType.)

name: Entrenched Position
text: This province gets +5 strength during [conflict-military] conflicts.

name: Fertile Fields
text: Action: During a conflict at this province – draw 1 card.

name: Manicured Garden
text: Action: During a conflict at this province – gain 1 fate.

name: Meditations on the Tao
text: Action: During a conflict at this province, choose an attacking character – remove 1 fate from that character.

name: Night Raid
text: Reaction: After this province is revealed – your opponent chooses and discards X cards from his or her hand. X is equal to the number of attacking characters.

name: Pilgrimage
text: During conflicts at this province, cancel all ring effects. (If this province breaks, resolve ring effects as normal.)

name: Rally to the Cause
text: Reaction: After this province is revealed – switch the conflict cardType. (The conflict retains its element.)

name: Shameful Display
text: Action: During a conflict at this province, choose 2 participating characters – honor one of those characters and dishonor the other.

name: Hida Guardian
text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, choose another participating character – until the end of the conflict, that character gets +2[conflict-military] and +2[conflict-political] for each holding you control.

name: Kaiu Envoy
text: Courtesy. (When this character leaves play, gain 1 fate.) Sincerity. (When this character leaves play, draw 1 card.)

name: Hiruma Yōjimbō
text: This character cannot be declared as an attacker.

name: Shrewd Yasuki
text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, if there is a holding in play – look at the top 2 cards of your conflict deck. Add 1 of those cards to your hand and place the other on the bottom of your conflict deck.

name: Vanguard Warrior
text: Action: Sacrifice this character. Choose a character – place 1 fate on that character.

name: Borderlands Defender
text: While this character is defending, opponents' card effects cannot bow it or move it.

name: Intimidating Hida
text: Reaction: After an opponent passes on declaring a conflict – that player loses 1 honor.

name: Vengeful Berserker
text: Reaction: After another character you control leaves play during a conflict – double this character's [conflict-military] skill until the end of the conflict.

name: Hida Tomonatsu
text: Reaction: After this character wins a conflict as a defender, sacrifice it. Choose a non-unique attacking character – return that character to the top of its owner's deck.

name: Steadfast Witch Hunter
text: Action: Sacrifice a (friendly) character. Choose a character – ready that character.

name: Kaiu Shuichi
text: Covert. (When this character attacks, choose one character without covert. That character cannot be declared as a defender.) Action: During a conflict in which this character is participating, if there is a holding in play – gain 1 fate.

name: Hida Kisada
text: While you have not lost a conflict this phase, cancel the effects of the first action ability your opponent triggers from a card during each conflict.

name: Borderlands Fortifications
text: Action: Choose a card in one of your provinces – switch this holding with that card.

name: Funeral Pyre
text: Action: Sacrifice a (friendly) character – draw 1 card.

name: Asahina Artisan
text: Action: During a conflict, bow this character. Choose another [clan-crane] character – that character gets +3[conflict-political] until the end of the conflict.

name: Brash Samurai
text: Action: While this character is your only participating character in a conflict – honor this character.

name: Cautious Scout
text: While this character is attacking alone, treat the defending province as if its printed text box were blank (except for Traits).

name: Doji Gift Giver
text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, give your opponent 1 fate. That opponent must choose a ready participating character he or she controls – bow that character.

name: Savvy Politician
text: Reaction: After this character is honored, choose a character – honor that character.

name: Daidoji Nerishma
text: Action: Choose a facedown card in one of your provinces – turn that card faceup.

name: Doji Challenger
text: Action: While this character is attacking, choose a character controlled by your opponent – move that character to this conflict.

name: Kakita Asami
text: Action: While this character is participating in a [conflict-political] conflict, if you count more current [conflict-political] skill in the conflict than your opponent – take 1 honor from that opponent.

name: Kakita Kaezin
text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, your opponent must choose a participating character he or she controls – challenge that character to a [conflict-military] duel. If this character wins, move each character not involved in the duel home. If it loses, send it home.

name: Asahina Storyteller
text: Sincerity. (When this character leaves play, draw 1 card.) Each honored [clan-crane] character you control gains sincerity.

name: Guest of Honor
text: While this character is participating in a conflict, opponents cannot play events.

name: Doji Hotaru
text: Reaction: After you claim a ring during a [conflict-political] conflict in which this character is participating – resolve that ring's effect.

name: Artisan Academy
text: Action: During the conflict phase – reveal the top card of your conflict deck. Until the end of the phase, you may play that card as if it were in your hand.

name: Doomed Shugenja
text: Limited. (No more than one limited card can be played by each player each round.) You cannot place fate on this character when it is played from one of your provinces.

name: Togashi Initiate
text: Action: While this character is attacking, spend 1 fate to an unclaimed ring – honor this character.

name: Agasha Swordsmith
text: Action: Search the top 5 cards of your conflict deck for an attachment, reveal it, and add it to your hand. Shuffle.

name: Mirumoto Prodigy
text: While this character is attacking alone, your opponent cannot declare more than one defender.

name: Niten Adept
text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, bow a (friendly) attachment on it. Choose a participating character without attachments – bow that character.

name: Seeker of Enlightenment
text: This character gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] for each fate on each unclaimed ring.

name: Enlightened Warrior
text: Reaction: After an opponent selects a ring with fate on it – place 1 fate on this character.

name: Kitsuki Investigator
text: Action: While this character is participating in a [conflict-political] conflict, spend 1 fate to an unclaimed ring – look at your opponent's hand. Choose 1 of those cards and discard it. (Max 1 per conflict.)

name: Mirumoto Raitsugu
text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, choose a participating character controlled by your opponent – challenge that character to a [conflict-military] duel. If the loser of the duel has no fate on it, discard it. Otherwise remove 1 fate from it.

name: Ascetic Visionary
text: No attachments except Monk or Tattoo. Action: While this character is attacking, spend 1 fate to an unclaimed ring. Choose a Monk character or a character with a Monk attachment – ready that character.

name: Niten Master
text: Reaction: After you attach a Weapon attachment to this character – ready this character. (Limit twice per round.)

name: Togashi Yokuni
text: Action: Choose a triggered ability printed on another character – this character gains that ability until the end of the phase. (Max 1 per round.)

name: Secluded Temple
text: Reaction: After the conflict phase begins, each opponent who controls more characters than you must choose a character he or she controls with 1 or more fate on it – remove 1 fate from each chosen character.

name: Obstinate Recruit
text: If an opponent is more honorable than you, discard this character.

name: Ikoma Prodigy
text: Reaction: After 1 or more fate is placed on this character – gain 1 honor.

name: Steadfast Samurai
text: Forced Reaction: After the fate phase begins, if you have at least 5 more honor than an opponent – this character cannot be discarded or lose fate this phase.

name: Akodo Gunsō
text: Pride. (After this character wins a conflict, honor it. After this character loses a conflict, dishonor it.) Reaction: After this character enters play from a province – refill that province faceup.

name: Deathseeker
text: Reaction: After this character loses a conflict as an attacker, sacrifice this character. Choose a character controlled by your opponent – if that character has no fate on it, discard it. Otherwise, remove 1 fate from that character.

name: Venerable Historian
text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, if you are more honorable than your opponent – honor this character.

name: Kitsu Spiritcaller
text: Action: During a conflict, bow this character. Choose a character in one of your discard piles – put that character into play in the conflict. If that character is still in play at the end of the conflict, return it to the bottom of its deck.

name: Lion's Pride Brawler
text: Action: While this character is attacking, choose a character with equal or lower [conflict-military] skill than this character – bow that character.

name: Matsu Beiona
text: Reaction: After this character enters play, if you control 3 or more other Bushi characters – place 2 fate on this character.

name: Honored General
text: During a conflict in which this character is participating, each other participating [clan-lion] character you control gets +1[conflict-military]. Reaction: After this character enters play – honor it.

name: Ikoma Eiji
text: Reaction: After you lose a [conflict-political] conflict – put a Bushi character with printed cost 3 or lower into play from your dynasty discard pile or provinces.

name: Akodo Toturi
text: Reaction: After you claim a ring during a [conflict-military] conflict in which this character is participating – resolve that ring's effect.

name: Staging Ground
text: Action: Choose up to 2 facedown cards in your provinces – turn the chosen cards faceup.

name: Naive Student
text: Sincerity. (When this character leaves play, draw 1 card.)

name: Shiba Peacemaker
text: This character cannot participate in conflicts as an attacker.

name: Solemn Scholar
text: Action: During a conflict, if the [element-earth] ring is in your claimed ring pool, choose an attacking character – bow that character.

name: Adept of the Waves
text: Action: Choose a character – until the end of the phase, that character gains covert during [element-water] conflicts.

name: Asako Diplomat
text: Reaction: After this character wins a conflict, choose a character – honor or dishonor that character.

name: Meddling Mediator
text: Action: If an opponent has declared 2 or more conflicts against you this phase, select one – take 1 fate or 1 honor from that opponent.

name: Radiant Orator
text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, if you count more current glory than your opponent among ready participating characters, choose an enemy character – move that character home.

name: Shiba Yōjimbō
text: Interrupt: When the effects of a triggered ability that targets a Shugenja you control would initiate – cancel those effects.

name: Isawa Masahiro
text: Action: During a [element-fire] conflict, bow this character. Choose a participating character with printed cost 2 or lower – discard that character.

name: Fearsome Mystic
text: This character gets +2 glory during [element-air] conflicts. Action: While this character is participating in a conflict – remove 1 fate from each participating character your opponent controls with lower glory than this character.

name: Isawa Atsuko
text: Action: During a [element-void] conflict – until the end of the conflict, each participating character you control gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] and each participating character your opponent controls gets –1[conflict-military] and –1[conflict-political].

name: Shiba Tsukune
text: Interrupt: When the conflict phase ends – resolve the ring effects of up to 2 unclaimed rings as if you were the attacking player.

name: Forgotten Library
text: Reaction: After the draw phase begins – draw 1 card.

name: Bayushi Liar
text: Sincerity. (When this character leaves play, draw 1 card.)

name: Bayushi Manipulator
text: Reaction: After honor dials are revealed – increase the value of your bid by 1.

name: Sinister Soshi
text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating character – that character gets –2[conflict-military] and –2[conflict-political] until the end of the conflict.

name: Blackmail Artist
text: Reaction: After this character wins a [conflict-political] conflict – take 1 honor from your opponent.

name: Soshi Illusionist
text: Action: Spend 1 fate, choose a character – discard a status token from that character.

name: Yogo Outcast
text: This character gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] while you are less honorable than an opponent.

name: Young Rumormonger
text: Interrupt: When a character would be honored or dishonored, choose another character controlled by the same player – that character receives the honor or dishonor instead.

name: Favored Niece
text: Action: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand – draw 1 card. (Limit twice per round.)

name: Shosuro Actress
text: Action: During a conflict, sacrifice this character. Choose a non-Shinobi character with printed cost 3 or lower in an opponent's discard pile – put that character into play in the conflict under your control.

name: Shosuro Miyako
text: Reaction: After you play a character from your hand, your opponent must select one – discard 1 card at random from his or her hand or choose and dishonor a character he or she controls.

name: Bayushi Yunako
text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, choose a character – switch that character's base [conflict-military] and [conflict-political] skill until the end of the conflict.

name: Yogo Hiroue
text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, choose a non-participating character – move that character to this conflict. Then, if you win the conflict, you may dishonor that character.

name: Bayushi Shoju
text: Action: While this character is participating in a [conflict-political] conflict, choose a participating character controlled by your opponent – until the end of the conflict, that character gets –1[conflict-political] and is discarded if its [conflict-political] skill is 0. (Limit twice per round.)

name: City of Lies
text: Action: Reduce the cost of the next event you play this phase by 1.

name: Moto Youth
text: This character gets +1[conflict-military] during the first [conflict-military] conflict each round.

name: Utaku Infantry
text: While this character is participating in a conflict, it gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] for each participating [clan-unicorn] character you control.

name: Aggressive Moto
text: This character cannot be declared as a defender.

name: Border Rider
text: Action: Ready this character.

name: Meishōdō Wielder
text: Reduce the cost to play this character by 1 while you are the first player.

name: Shinjo Outrider
text: Action: During a conflict – move this character to the conflict.

name: Giver of Gifts
text: Action: Choose an attachment you control – move that attachment to an eligible character you control.

name: Ide Trader
text: Reaction: After 1 or more characters move to a conflict in which this character is participating, select one – gain 1 fate or draw 1 card. (Limit once per conflict.)

name: Warrior Poet
text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict – each participating character controlled by your opponent gets –1[conflict-military] and –1[conflict-political] until the end of the conflict.

name: Utaku Yumino
text: Action: During a conflict, discard a card from your hand – this character gets +2[conflict-military] and +2[conflict-political] until the end of the conflict. (Limit once per conflict.)

name: Moto Horde
text: No attachments except Weapon.

name: Shinjo Tatsuo
text: Action: During a conflict, choose this character and up to 1 other character you control – move those characters to the conflict.

name: Shinjo Altansarnai
text: Reaction: After you break a province during a [conflict-military] conflict in which this character is participating, your opponent chooses a character he or she controls – discard that character.

name: Otomo Courtier
text: This character cannot participate in conflicts as an attacker against a player that controls the Imperial Favor.

name: Seppun Guardsman
text: This character cannot participate in conflicts as an attacker against a player that controls the Imperial Favor.

name: Keeper Initiate
text: Keeper role only. Reaction: After you claim a ring that matches the element of your role – put this character into play from your dynasty discard pile or provinces. Then, put 1 fate on this character.

name: Miya Mystic
text: Action: During the conflict phase, sacrifice this character. Choose an attachment – discard that attachment.

name: Seeker Initiate
text: Seeker role only. Reaction: After you claim a ring that matches the element of your role – search the top 5 cards of your conflict deck for a card and add it to your hand. Shuffle.

name: Wandering Ronin
text: Action: During a conflict, remove 1 fate from this character – it gets +2[conflict-military] and +2[conflict-political] until the end of the conflict. (Limit twice per conflict.)

name: Favorable Ground
text: Action: During a conflict, sacrifice this holding. Choose a character you control – move that character to the conflict or home from the conflict.

name: Imperial Storehouse
text: Action: Sacrifice this holding – draw 1 card.

name: Hiruma Ambusher
text: Reaction: After this character enters play as a defender, choose a character – that character's abilities cannot be triggered during this conflict.

name: Stoic Gunsō
text: Action: During a conflict, sacrifice a (friendly) character – this character gets +3[conflict-military] until the end of the conflict.

name: Reprieve
text: Interrupt: When attached character would leave play – discard this attachment instead.

name: Watch Commander
text: Attach to a character you control. Limit 1 per character. Reaction: After an opponent plays a card during a conflict in which attached character is participating – that player loses 1 honor. (Unlimited.)

name: Jade Tetsubō
text: Attach to a character you control. Restricted. Action: While attached character is participating in a conflict, bow this attachment. Choose a participating character with lower [conflict-military] skill than attached character – return all fate on that character to its owner's fate pool.

name: Levy
text: Action: Choose an opponent, that player must select one – give you 1 fate or 1 honor.

name: Rebuild
text: Action: Shuffle a card in one of your unbroken provinces back into your dynasty deck. Choose a holding in your dynasty discard pile – put that holding into play in that province.

name: Way of the Crab
text: Action: Sacrifice a (friendly) [clan-crab] character. Choose an opponent – that player must sacrifice a character. (Max 1 per round.)

name: The Mountain Does Not Fall
text: Action: Choose a character – until the end of the phase, that character does not bow as a result of conflict resolution while defending. (Max 1 per round.)

name: Steward of Law
text: While this character is participating in a conflict, characters cannot become dishonored.

name: Political Rival
text: Covert. (When this character attacks, choose one character without covert. That character cannot be declared as a defender.) This character gets +3[conflict-political] while defending.

name: Above Question
text: Attached character cannot be chosen as a target of an opponent's event.

name: Duelist Training
text: Attached character gains: "Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, choose a participating character controlled by your opponent – challenge that character to a [conflict-military] duel. Instead of giving honor for this duel's bid, a player may choose and discard the required number of cards from hand. Bow the loser of the duel."

name: Height of Fashion
text: This attachment cannot be played during a conflict.

name: The Perfect Gift
text: Action: Reveal the top 4 cards of each player's conflict deck. Choose 1 revealed card owned by each player and add it to its owner's hand. Shuffle.

name: Voice of Honor
text: Interrupt: When the effects of an event would initiate, if you control more honored characters than an opponent – cancel those effects.

name: Way of the Crane
text: Action: Choose a [clan-crane] character you control – honor that character.

name: Admit Defeat
text: Action: Choose a character that is defending alone – bow that character.

name: Noble Sacrifice
text: Action: Sacrifice a (friendly) honored character. Choose a dishonored character – discard that character.

name: Tattooed Wanderer
text: You may play this character as an attachment with the text: "Attached character gains covert."

name: Togashi Kazue
text: You may play this character as an attachment with the text: "Action: During a conflict in which attached character is participating, choose another participating character – move 1 fate from that character to the attached character."

name: Ancestral Daishō
text: Ancestral. (When attached card leaves play, return this card to your hand.) Restricted. (No more than two restricted attachments per character.)

name: Daimyō's Favor
text: Attach to a character you control. Action: Bow this attachment – reduce the cost of the next attachment you play on this character this phase by 1.

name: Kitsuki's Method
text: Ancestral. (When attached card leaves play, return this card to your hand.) Restricted. (No more than two restricted attachments per character.)

name: Way of the Dragon
text:
Attach to a character you control. Limit 1 per character.
You may trigger each of attached character's triggered abilities an additional time each round (or specified period).

name: Let Go
text: Action: Choose an attachment – discard it.

name: Mantra of Fire
text: Reaction: After an opponent declares a [element-fire] conflict, choose a Monk character or a character with a Monk attachment – place 1 fate on that character and draw 1 card.

name: Tranquility
text: Action: During a conflict – until the end of the conflict, characters in your opponent's home cannot trigger abilities.

name: Indomitable Will
text: Reaction: After you win a conflict in which you control only a single participating character – that character does not bow as a result of the conflict's resolution.

name: Mirumoto's Fury
text: Action: During a conflict, choose an attacking character with glory X or lower – bow that character. X is equal to the number of unrevealed provinces you control.

name: Vengeful Oathkeeper
text: Reaction: After you lose a [conflict-military] conflict – put this character into play from your hand.

name: Master of the Spear
text: Action: While this character is attacking, your opponent must choose a participating character he or she controls – move that character home.

name: Guidance of the Ancestors
text: Action: Play this attachment from your conflict discard pile.

name: Honored Blade
text: Restricted. (No more than two restricted attachments per character.) Reaction: After attached character wins a conflict – gain 1 honor.

name: Sashimono
text: Attach to a Bushi character you control. Attached character does not bow as a result of conflict resolution during [conflict-military] conflicts.

name: Ready for Battle
text: Reaction: After an opponent's card effect or a ring effect bows a character you control – ready that character.

name: Stand Your Ground
text: Interrupt: When an honored character you control would leave play – instead discard that character's status token.

name: Way of the Lion
text: Action: During a conflict, choose a [clan-lion] character – double that character's base [conflict-military] skill until the end of the conflict.

name: For Greater Glory
text: Reaction: After you break a province during a [conflict-military] conflict – place 1 fate on each participating Bushi character you control. (Max 1 per conflict.)

name: Strength in Numbers
text: Action: While you are the attacking player, choose a defending character with glory X or lower – move that character home. X is equal to the number of attacking characters.

name: Ishiken Initiate
text: This character gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] for each claimed ring.

name: Seeker of Knowledge
text: While this character is attacking, the contested ring gains the [element-air] element. If this character wins the conflict as an attacker, you may choose which of its ring effects to resolve.

name: Magnificent Kimono
text: Attached character gains pride. (After this character wins a conflict, honor it. After this character loses a conflict, dishonor it.)

name: Grasp of Earth
text: Attach to a Shugenja character you control. Action: During a conflict, bow this attachment – opponents' characters cannot move to this conflict or be played from hand until the end of the conflict.

name: Pacifism
text:
This attachment cannot be played during a conflict.
Attached character cannot participate in [conflict-military] conflicts.

name: Supernatural Storm
text: Action: Choose a participating character – that character gets +X[conflict-military] and +X[conflict-political] until the end of the conflict. X is equal to the number of Shugenja characters you control.

name: Way of the Phoenix
text: Action: Choose a ring and an opponent – that player cannot declare conflicts of that ring's element this phase. (Max 1 per phase.)

name: Against the Waves
text: Action: Choose a Shugenja character – bow or ready that character.

name: Know the World
text: Action: Switch a ring in your claimed ring pool with an unclaimed ring and gain all fate on that ring. (Retain the ring's conflict cardType.)

name: Display of Power
text: Reaction: After you lose an unopposed conflict – cancel the ring effect of that conflict. Then, you resolve that ring effect as if you had won the conflict as the attacking player. Claim that ring.

name: Adept of Shadows
text: Action: Lose 1 honor – return this character to your hand.

name: Unassuming Yōjimbō
text: Covert. (When this character attacks, choose one character without covert. That character cannot be declared as a defender.)

name: Court Mask
text: Attach to a character you control. Action: Return this attachment to your hand and dishonor attached character.

name: Forged Edict
text: Interrupt: When the effects of an event would initiate, dishonor a (friendly) Courtier character – cancel those effects.

name: Way of the Scorpion
text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating non-[clan-scorpion] character – dishonor that character.

name: Calling in Favors
text: Action: Dishonor a (friendly) character. Choose an opponent's attachment – take control of that attachment and attach it to that character, if able. Otherwise, discard the attachment.

name: I Can Swim
text: Action: During a conflict, if the bid on your honor dial is higher than an opponent's, choose a participating dishonored character controlled by that opponent – discard that character.

name: Ambush
text: Action: During a conflict, choose up to 2 [clan-scorpion] characters with total printed cost 6 or lower from your hand and/or provinces – put those characters into play as participating characters.

name: Blackmail
text: Play only if you are less honorable than your opponent. Action: During a conflict, choose a character with printed cost 2 or lower controlled by your opponent – take control of that character until the end of the conflict.

name: Iuchi Wayfinder
text: Reaction: After this character enters play – look at a facedown province.

name: Ide Messenger
text: Action: During a conflict, spend 1 fate. Choose a character you control – move that character to the conflict.

name: Favored Mount
text: Attach to a character you control. Attached character gains Cavalry. Action: During a conflict, bow this attachment – move attached character to the conflict.

name: Spyglass
text: Reaction: After attached character commits to a conflict or moves to a conflict – draw 1 card. (Limit twice per round.)

name: Born in War
text: Cavalry character only. X is equal to the number of unclaimed rings.

name: Breakthrough
text: Reaction: After the resolution of your first conflict this phase as the attacking player, if that conflict broke a province – immediately declare your second conflict for this phase.

name: Captive Audience
text: Action: During a [conflict-political] conflict, lose 1 honor – change the conflict cardType to [conflict-military].

name: I Am Ready
text: Action: Remove 1 fate from a (friendly) [clan-unicorn] character – ready that character.

name: Way of the Unicorn
text: Interrupt: When you would pass the first player token – keep it instead.

name: Cavalry Reserves
text: Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict, choose up to 6 printed cost worth of Cavalry characters in your dynasty discard pile – put those characters into play in the conflict.

name: Fine Katana
text: Restricted. (No more than two restricted attachments per character.)

name: Ornate Fan
text: Restricted. (No more than two restricted attachments per character.)

name: Cloud the Mind
text: Play only if you control a Shugenja character. Treat attached character as if its printed text box were blank (except for Traits).

name: Assassination
text: Action: During a conflict, lose 3 honor. Choose a character with printed cost 2 or lower – discard that character. (Max 1 per round.)

name: Banzai!
text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating character – that character gets +2[conflict-military] until the end of the conflict. You may lose 1 honor to resolve this ability twice. (Max 1 per conflict.)

name: Contingency Plan
text: Reaction: After honor dials are revealed – increase or decrease the value of your bid by 1 (to a minimum of 0).

name: Court Games
text: Action: During a [conflict-political] conflict, select one – choose and honor a participating character you control, or your opponent chooses and dishonors a participating character he or she controls. (Max 1 per conflict.)

name: For Shame!
text: Action: During a conflict, if you control a participating Courtier character, choose a participating character controlled by your opponent. Your opponent must select one – dishonor the chosen character or bow it.

name: Good Omen
text: Play only if your honor bid is lower than an opponent's. Action: Choose a character with printed cost 3 or higher – place 1 fate on that character.

name: Spies at Court
text: Reaction: After you win a [conflict-political] conflict, dishonor a (friendly) participating character – discard 2 cards at random from your opponent's hand. (Max 1 per conflict.)

name: Charge!
text: Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict, choose a character in one of your provinces – put that character into play in the conflict.

name: Fallen in Battle
text: Reaction: After you win a [conflict-military] conflict by 5 or more skill, choose a participating character – discard that character. (Max 1 per conflict.)

name: Outwit
text: Action: During a conflict, choose an opponent's character with lower [conflict-political] skill than a participating Courtier character you control – move the chosen character home.

name: Rout
text: Action: During a conflict, choose an opponent's character with lower [conflict-military] skill than a participating Bushi character you control – move the chosen character home.

name: Keeper of Air
text: Increase your deckbuilding influence value by 3. Reaction: After you win an [element-air] conflict as the defending player – gain 1 fate.

name: Seeker of Air
text: You may replace 1 province of any element with an additional [element-air] province while deckbuilding. Reaction: After an [element-air] province you control is revealed – gain 1 fate.

name: Keeper of Earth
text: Increase your deckbuilding influence value by 3. Reaction: After you win an [element-earth] conflict as the defending player – gain 1 fate.

name: Seeker of Earth
text: You may replace 1 province of any element with an additional [element-earth] province while deckbuilding. Reaction: After an [element-earth] province you control is revealed – gain 1 fate.

name: Keeper of Fire
text: Increase your deckbuilding influence value by 3. Reaction: After you win a [element-fire] conflict as the defending player – gain 1 fate.

name: Seeker of Fire
text: You may replace 1 province of any element with an additional [element-fire] province while deckbuilding. Reaction: After a [element-fire] province you control is revealed – gain 1 fate.

name: Keeper of Water
text: Increase your deckbuilding influence value by 3. Reaction: After you win a [element-water] conflict as the defending player – gain 1 fate.

name: Seeker of Water
text: You may replace 1 province of any element with an additional [element-water] province while deckbuilding. Reaction: After a [element-water] province you control is revealed – gain 1 fate.

name: Keeper of Void
text: Increase your deckbuilding influence value by 3. Reaction: After you win a [element-void] conflict as the defending player – gain 1 fate.

name: Seeker of Void
text: You may replace 1 province of any element with an additional [element-void] province while deckbuilding. Reaction: After a [element-void] province you control is revealed – gain 1 fate.
